content.question: Two short wire segments are shown in the figure above. Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is made from a known material and is measured along its length to have a resistance of <math alttext="12 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the minimum amount of data needed for Wire <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> in order to estimate its resistance without measuring the resistance directly?

choices.label: Only the length relative to Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Only the length and diameter relative to Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
Only the length relative to Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the type of material
The length and diameter relative to Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the type of material

content.answer: The length and diameter relative to Wire <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the type of material

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
